metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: The tool below allows you to work out the em sizes from pixels (or vice versa).
content.html: The tool below allows you to work out the em sizes from pixels (or vice versa).

Convert PX to EM:
px

Convert EM to PX:
em

content.text: In the table below, select a body font size in pixels (px) to display a complete "px to em and percent" conversion table.
content.html: In the table below, select a body font size in pixels (px) to display a complete "px to em and percent" conversion table.

content.text: Tip: The default font size is usually 16px.
content.html: Tip: The default font size is usually 16px.

content.text: What is the difference between PX, EM and Percent?
content.html: What is the difference between PX, EM and Percent?

content.text: Pixel is a static measurement, while percent and EM are relative measurements. The size of an EM or percent depends on its parent. If the text size of body is 16 pixels, then 150% or 1.5 EM will be 24 pixels (1.5 * 16). Look at CSS Units for more measurement units.
content.html: Pixel is a static measurement, while percent and EM are relative measurements. The size of an EM or percent depends on its parent. If the text size of body is 16 pixels, then 150% or 1.5 EM will be 24 pixels (1.5 * 16). Look at CSS Units for more measurement units.
